009
010package imagingbook.common.histogram;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * This class represents a discrete "cumulative distribution function" that is
015 * piecewise linear. See Sec. 3.6.3 (Fig. 3.12) of [1] for additional details.
016 * </p>
017 * <p>
018 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
019 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
020 * </p>
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 *
024 */
025public class PiecewiseLinearCdf {
026        
027        private final int K;
028        private final int[] iArr;
029        private final double[] pArr;
030        
031        /**
032         * <p>
033         * Constructor, creates a {@link PiecewiseLinearCdf} from a sequence of 
034         * brightness / cumulative probability pairs.
035         * See Sec. 3.6.3 (Fig. 3.12) of [1] for additional details.
036         * Usage example:
037         * </p>
038         * <pre>
039         * int[] ik = {28, 75, 150, 210};
040         * double[] Pk = {.05, .25, .75, .95};
041         * PiecewiseLinearCdf pLCdf = new PiecewiseLinearCdf(256, ik, Pk);</pre>
042         * <p>
043         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
044         * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
045         * </p>
046         * 
047         * @param K number of brightness values (typ. 256)
048         * @param a a sequence of brightness values serving as control points
049         * @param b a sequence of cumulative probability values in [0,1], one for each control point
050         */
051        public PiecewiseLinearCdf(int K, int[] a, double[] b) {
052                this.K = K; // number of intensity values (typ. 256)
053                int N = a.length;
054                iArr = new int[N + 2];          // array of intensity values
055                pArr = new double[N + 2];       // array of cum. distribution values
056                iArr[0] = -1; 
057                pArr[0] = 0;
058                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
059                        iArr[i + 1] = a[i];
060                        pArr[i + 1] = b[i];
061                }
062                iArr[N + 1] = K - 1;
063                pArr[N + 1] = 1;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Returns the cumulative probability for the specified intensity value.
068         * 
069         * @param i the intensity value
070         * @return the associated cumulative probability
071         */
072        public double getCdf(int i) {
073                if (i < 0)
074                        return 0;
075                else if (i >= K - 1)
076                        return 1;
077                else {
078                        int s = 0, N = iArr.length - 1;
079                        for (int j = 0; j <= N; j++) { // find s (segment index)
080                                if (iArr[j] <= i)
081                                        s = j;
082                                else
083                                        break;
084                        }
085                        return pArr[s] + (i - iArr[s])
086                                        * ((pArr[s + 1] - pArr[s]) / (iArr[s + 1] - iArr[s]));
087                }
088        }
089        
090        /**
091         * Returns the cumulative probabilities for the intensity values
092         * 0 to 255 as a {@code double[]}.
093         * 
094         * @return the array of cumulative probabilities
095         */
096        public double[] getCdf() {
097                double[] P = new double[256];
098                for (int i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
099                        P[i] = this.getCdf(i);
100                }
101                return P;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns the inverse cumulative probability function a = P<sup>-1</sup>(a), that is,
106         * the intensity value a associated with a given cum. probability P.
107         * 
108         * @param P a cumulative probability
109         * @return the associated intensity
110         */
111        public double getInverseCdf(double P) {
112                if (P < getCdf(0))
113                        return 0;
114                else if (P >= 1)
115                        return K - 1;
116                else {
117                        int r = 0, N = iArr.length - 1;
118                        for (int j = 0; j <= N; j++) { // find r (segment index)
119                                if (pArr[j] <= P)
120                                        r = j;
121                                else
122                                        break;
123                        }
124                        return iArr[r] + (P - pArr[r]) * ((iArr[r + 1] - iArr[r]) / (pArr[r + 1] - pArr[r]));
125                }
126        }
127        
128        /**
129         * Returns the probability function for this distribution
130         * as a discrete array of probabilities.
131         * 
132         * @return the probability array
133         */
134        public double[] getPdf() {      
135                double[] prob = new double[K];
136                prob[0] =  getCdf(0);
137                for (int i = 1; i < K; i++) {
138                        prob[i] =  getCdf(i) - getCdf(i-1);
139                }
140                return prob;
141        }
142        
143}
